snippet: Judge Mary C. Jacobson on Thursday dismissed the state’s request to prevent weddings until after an appeal is completed.
abstract: Judge Mary C Jacobson of New Jersey State Superior Court dismisses state's request to prevent same-sex weddings until after appeal of court decision allowing them is completed; says there is no public interest in depriving class of state's residents their constitutional rights while appellate review is pursued; ruling clears the way for same-sex marriages to start in New Jersey on October 21.
lead_paragraph: Judge Mary C. Jacobson on Thursday dismissed the state’s request to prevent weddings until after an appeal is completed.

headline.main: Judge Says New Jersey Can Begin Allowing Same-Sex Marriages in Two Weeks
headline.print_headline: Judge Says New Jersey Can Begin Allowing Same-Sex Marriages in Two Weeks

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
